Imo a "Backup" as dropdown option for each site in the sidebar would render this attack pretty ineffective.
Backup should simply zip the locally cached website and allow any user to store a backup as one convinient file to protect from unwanted updates like in case of ZeroTV.

One other idea would be a zerogit site, but the Backup option would do for now, since every site should be self-contained.

For merger sites, the hubs cannot be easily attacked(?), since every users data should be only manipulatable by the user only, or does the hub owner have special rights to render all content useless?
